metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10773 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A stack information leak flaw was found in s390/s390x in the Linux kernelâ€™smemory manager functionality, where it incorrectly writes to the/proc/sys/vm/cmm_timeout file. This flaw allows a local user to see thekernel data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10773` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-72.81
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-72.81
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-72.81
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-72.81
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-72.81
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.3.0-26-generic - 5.3.0-26.28~18.04.1
linux-image-5.3.0-26-generic-lpae - 5.3.0-26.28~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-72.81').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-26.28~18.04.1').

linux-aws package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.58').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
